main event: An unidentified metallic object was observed traversing at a slow rate of speed in the sky over Poughkeepsie, New York on June 17, 1954.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 1 hour.
The object was tracked by ground-based radar.
The report concludes the object was most likely a weather balloon.
The object was described as silvery in color and round in shape, about 100 feet in diameter.
The witness reported the object appeared to descend and flutter out of view.
